mods.abstract: Female adult, Hoke-tee Seminole Indian, palm tree fiber head and all body, stitched features, long skirt is made of several different colors of fabric, horizontally patched together, semi-fitted strapless under-bodice, another short skirt-like outer cape patched with different fabrics, bead necklace, body, hand-made, costume, machine-made. Accompanying information describes that a totally different Indian people live in the Southeastern part of this country. In Florida, these are the Seminoles, a tribe that separated from the Greek nation in the late 18th century. The name Seminole means 'seceder'. Bands of various colored materials are sewed together to make the dress and often the cape. Many strings of beads are worn. The doll is made from palm tree fiber.""
mods.accessCondition: Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.

recordInfo.recordOrigin: Transformed into MODS from extended Dublin Core by the LDL Development Team at Louisiana State University.
